definition: unlicensed or unofficial taxi/unlicensed motor vehicle
abbr. for Heilongjiang province 黑龍江|黑龙江[Hei1 long2 jiang1]
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: The drivers in Gansu agreed to end their strike after the authorities promised to crack down on unlicensed taxis.
sentences.chinese: 甘肅司機同意，當局承諾打擊無照黑車後，結束罷工。

sentences.english: It is time the authorities concerned took proper steps to solve these illegal vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 該是有關當局採取適當的措施來解決黑車的時候了。

sentences.english: We watched as he got into a large black limousine and sped away.
sentences.chinese: 我們看着他鑽進一輛黑車豪華轎車飛馳而去了。

sentences.english: She said to steer clear of private cabs, like this one.
sentences.chinese: 她說要避開個體的黑車，比如剛纔的那輛。

sentences.english: The robbery on "unlicensed car" belongs to the robbery on public traffic robbery.
sentences.chinese: 在“黑車”上搶劫屬於在公共交通工具上搶劫。

definition: to make a detour/to take the long route
local bus or train/slow train with many stops
to drive a vehicle for its owner (often as a paid service for sb who has consumed alcohol) (abbr. for 代理駕駛|代理驾驶[dai4 li3 jia4 shi3])/substitute driver (abbr. for 代駕司機|代驾司机[dai4 jia4 si1 ji1])
to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
soft sleeper (a type of sleeper train ticket class with a softer bunk)
